snippet: After a last-minute deal that cut the money requested in half, a key state board unanimously voted in favor of a loan from federal clean-water funds to the New York State Thruway Authority.
abstract: New York's Public Authorities Control Board approves $256 million loan from federal clean-water funds to New York State Thruway Authority to help finance building of a $3.9 billion twin-span replacement for Tappan Zee Bridge.
lead_paragraph: After a last-minute deal that cut the money requested in half, a key state board unanimously voted in favor of a loan from federal clean-water funds to the New York State Thruway Authority.

headline.main: New York State Board Approves Reduced $256 Million Loan for Tappan Zee Project
headline.print_headline: State Board Approves Reduced $256 Million Loan for Tappan Zee Project
